ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Guise
ygData.msgSnippet: My experience has run full spectrum.  Some of my best friends on Rodcet Nife are from pickup groups...one guy I am grouping with now (mid 30s) I first met in
ygData.messageBody:
My experience has run full spectrum. Some of my best
friends on Rodcet Nife are from pickup groups...one
guy I am grouping with now (mid 30s) I first met in
Crushbone at 7th lvl and haven't seen him since until
this week.

On the other hand, I've seen some really bad things
too. I won't bore anyone with more horror stories, my
rule of thumb though, is that if I get a bad feeling
about a group or if they don't work well together, I
excuse myself and move on.


--- "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...> wrote:
> I still don't understand how you have so many
> problems with Pickup groups?
> On Saryrn we never have those problems. Even on
> Veeshan I never had a
> problem. Pickup groups were nearly as good as some
> of our guild groups,
> some were worse but none were as bad as some of the
> things you've related on
> this board ;)
>
> IMO Pickup groups are awesome because you get to
> learn new tactics to go
> with other people who you aren't used to grouping
> with. Maybe I just adapt
> on the fly better. Maybe you just have some really
> lousy players on your
> server ;) Dunno. I've never had a problem with a
> pickup group.
>
> Biggest Key in a pickup group: Talk about who's
> going to do what before you
> head anywhere in the dungeon. Don't wait till AFTER
> you start breaking the
> room to discuss who does what.
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur
> Bard of Norrath
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Cyr, Thierry" <thierry.cyr@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, August 08, 2000 3:03 PM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Guise
>
>
> > well let me explain myself then, i was assuming he
> was going to guk alone
> > considering he had invis potions, i myself hate
> pickup groups (remember
> the
> > threads named Group from hell? well i've had 2 in
> a row). So unless you
> get
> > to guk with a group, hope there's someone in the
> tower allready so ya can
> > join up with them, or ya might end up like me last
> night, with a warrior
> > getting to the bridge, yelling uh oh and training
> all the wizards and the
> > gibs to the BR. needless to say i didnt make it to
> the zone. So ya i hope
> > for him that unless he has a group allready, that
> the ass is camped or
> he'll
> > never get it alone.
> >
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----

> be

> masks rot away.
